meanings.definition: A sudden rush of air or sound.
meanings.sent1: The whoofs from the passing train startled the birds.
meanings.sent2: I heard the whoofs of the wind as the storm approached.
meanings.sent3: The whoofs of the balloon deflating made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The whoofs of laughter filled the room during the comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The whoofs of the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: To emit a sudden rush of air or sound.
meanings.sent1: The dog whoofs happily when playing fetch.
meanings.sent2: She whoofs loudly when blowing out the birthday candles.
meanings.sent3: The old car whoofs and sputters before starting up.
meanings.sent4: The steam engine whoofs as it chugs along the tracks.
meanings.sent5: The teapot whoofs as it reaches boiling point.

meanings.definition: The plural form of whoof, meaning a sudden rush of air or sound.
meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with the whoofs of the animals at night.
meanings.sent2: We could hear the distant whoofs of the fireworks display.
meanings.sent3: The whoofs of the leaves rustling in the wind created a soothing melody.
meanings.sent4: The whoofs of the waves crashing against the shore were calming.
meanings.sent5: The whoofs of the thunderstorm echoed through the valley.
